result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Daniel Thayer

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Cases 22CF88 and 21CF217 called together.  Defendant Jeremy Daniel Thayer in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Jeremy Daniel Thayer.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Court: def pleading to amended Count 1 of 21CF217: 4th degree sexual assault with joint rec for time-served and court costs; 240 days jail credit (stipulated).  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  State moves to amend Count 1 of 21CF217, argues in support/provides basis; Court grants amendment.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 of 21CF217 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and cases are DRI.  DA assures VR compliance.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders: 9 months jail (time-served, 240 days jail credit).  $200 DNA only.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:29 AM Cases 22CF88 and 21CF217 called together.  Defendant Jeremy Daniel Thayer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Jeremy Daniel Thayer.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: cases are still resolved if offer remains in place; State reviews, confirms the offer stands.  Court takes judicial notice of the def's pro-se bond motion.  Atty Pollak argues in support of bond modification to $500 cash.  Atty Schmidt responds.  Court denies the bond modification.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Def letter to court RE: bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant must post $2,000 new cash bond to be released from custody.  Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22CF88 and 21CF217.  No contact with victim or her residence.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

2:14 PM Cases 21CF217 and 22CF88 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy Daniel Thayer not in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Jeremy Daniel Thayer. Def fails to appear by any means.  Court reviews for service.  Atty Pollak makes statement, requests judge stay a warrant if she orders one.  State argues for warrant and forfeiture of cash.  Court orders warrant, body only.  Court orders cash bond forfeited.  Court stays warrant until 6/30/22 at 3pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

2:16 PM Cases 21CF217 and 22CF88 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy Daniel Thayer not in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Jeremy Daniel Thayer.   Moving Plea/sentencing (def ill) to a later date and time.  State assures VR compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Amended 4/14/22 to cover both files.  No contact with victim or her residence.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 09:39 AM Cases 21CF217, 22CF88 called together.  Defendant, Jeremy Daniel Thayer, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Def by phone without court's approval.  Case 22CF88 on for an Initial Appearance; atty Pollak states he was unaware of the new file- has not gone over the complaint.  Court addresses def's telephone appearance; must be in person for next hearing or warrant will be issued.  Court provides complaint to def atty and does formal reading.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Bond to extend to both files.  WTLPH.  Atty Pollak- agreement reached.  State recites global agreement- def to plead to amended 4th degree sex assault time-served with 205 days jail credit; State provides basis for agreement.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
